---
title: "config.yml"
---

## High-level description

This YAML configuration file is used to customize the GitHub issue template for the repository. It disables blank issues and provides a link to the Lago Community Slack for users to ask questions and submit feature requests.

## Symbols

### `blank_issues_enabled`
#### Description
This setting controls whether users can create issues without using a template.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| blank_issues_enabled | boolean | Determines if blank issues are allowed |

#### Outputs
No specific outputs. This setting affects the behavior of the GitHub repository's issue creation process.

### `contact_links`
#### Description
This section defines external links for users to access additional support or community resources.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| name | string | The display name for the contact link |
| url | string | The URL of the external resource |
| about | string | A brief description of the resource |

#### Outputs
No specific outputs. This section provides information that will be displayed to users when they attempt to create an issue.

## Configuration
| Option | Type | Default | Description |
|:-------|:-----|:--------|:------------|
| blank_issues_enabled | boolean | false | Disables the creation of blank issues |

| Contact Link | URL | Description |
|:-------------|:----|:------------|
| Lago Community | https://www.getlago.com/slack | Slack community for questions and feature requests |

## API/Interface Reference
This configuration file indirectly affects the GitHub Issues interface for the repository:

| Action | Result |
|:-------|:-------|
| Attempt to create a blank issue | Blocked; user is directed to use a template or contact link |
| View issue creation options | User sees the Lago Community Slack link as an alternative to creating an issue |

This configuration encourages users to use the Slack community for general questions and feature requests, potentially reducing the number of unnecessary issues in the GitHub repository and directing users to a more interactive support channel.
